<a id="Texture3D"></a>

# Texture3D

**Inherits:** [Texture](Texture.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [CompressedTexture3D](CompressedTexture3D.md), [ImageTexture3D](ImageTexture3D.md), [NoiseTexture3D](NoiseTexture3D.md), [PlaceholderTexture3D](PlaceholderTexture3D.md), [Texture3DRD](Texture3DRD.md)

Base class for 3-dimensional textures.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Base class for [ImageTexture3D](ImageTexture3D.md) and [CompressedTexture3D](CompressedTexture3D.md). Cannot be used directly, but contains all the functions necessary for accessing the derived resource types. **Texture3D** is the base class for all 3-dimensional texture types. See also [TextureLayered](TextureLayered.md).

All images need to have the same width, height and number of mipmap levels.

To create such a texture file yourself, reimport your image files using the Redot Editor import presets.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

[Resource](Resource.md) **create_placeholder**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_create_placeholder)

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_get_data"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[Image](Image.md)\] **get_data**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_get_data)

Returns the **Texture3D**'s data as an array of [Image](Image.md)\\ s. Each [Image](Image.md) represents a *slice* of the **Texture3D**, with different slices mapping to different depth (Z axis) levels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_get_depth"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_depth**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_get_depth)

Returns the **Texture3D**'s depth in pixels. Depth is typically represented by the Z axis (a dimension not present in [Texture2D](Texture2D.md)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_get_format"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Format](Image.md#enum_Image_Format) **get_format**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_get_format)

Returns the current format being used by this texture.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_get_height"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_height**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_get_height)

Returns the **Texture3D**'s height in pixels. Width is typically represented by the Y axis.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_get_width"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_width**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_get_width)

Returns the **Texture3D**'s width in pixels. Width is typically represented by the X axis.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Texture3D_method_has_mipmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_mipmaps**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Texture3D_method_has_mipmaps)

Returns ``true`` if the **Texture3D** has generated mipmaps.
